added_lines: def run_count_test(self, query_string): resp, response_body = self.monasca_client.list_alarms(query_string) # Make sure something was found self.assertTrue(expected_count > 0) resp, response_body = self.monasca_client.count_alarms(query_string) # test filter by severity @test.attr(type='gate') def test_filter_severity(self): self.run_count_test("?severity=LOW") # test filter by state @test.attr(type='gate') def test_filter_state(self): self.run_count_test("?state=ALARM") # test filter by metric name @test.attr(type='gate') def test_filter_metric_name(self): self.run_count_test("?metric_name=test_metric_01") self.run_count_test("?metric_dimensions=hostname:test_1,unique:1")

v2 registry gets invoked if teh registry opts are

is not preferred.

v1 image api and v2 image api can be configured individually.

commit_message:
Stricter checks for registry API calls

When v1 images API is enabled and v2 disabled, v2 registry gets
invoked if the registry opts are left with the defaults. i.e.,
v1_api makes a call to v2_registry. This is an API mismatch and
is not preferred.

NOTE:
v1 image api and v2 image api can be configured individually.
This patch performs stricter checks to ensure correct registry
API calls as follows:
* If enable_v1_api is set to True, enable_v1_registry
  MUST be set to True.
  So make a call to v1 registry only if both enable_v1_api
  and enable_v1_registry are set to True.
* enable_v2_registry need not be set to True even if
  enable_v2_api is set to True.
  So only if enable_v2_registry and enable_v2_api are set
  to True we make a call to v2_registry. This is required as
  a be-sure mechanism to prevent a call to v2_registry when
  ONLY v1_api is enabled. (See bug report)

Change-Id: I07a1d02070a0f041d5076ec1fefa783ce875c1d8
Closes-Bug: 1516706

commit_message:
Fix: InvalidParameterValue Exception not raised correctly

InvalidParameterValue Exception was not properly raised which
resulted in Error 500.

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files

(cherry picked from commit 8117a8224560d9d1ee9a168bf069a5d3373a5547)

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

Change-Id: I60f8aa7cfb61b15be847fb3d380b0926fb1009dd
(cherry picked from commit 8117a8224560d9d1ee9a168bf069a5d3373a5547)

self._retype_volume_qos('available', 'front-end', 202, False, False) def test_retype_volume_orig_no_qos_dest_be_available(self): # should NOT fail if changing qos enforced by back-end on the new type subject: Use RDO/UCA everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/commit/55afc237cb253c81d135e4def7cbb230e5dbddff', 'message': "Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)

commit_message:
Use https for *.openstack.org references

The openstack.org pages now support https and our references to
the site should by default be one signed by the organization.

Change-Id: I8a0588259d7b3fc8bd10504ffba7129b840e2a0d
